task.title: Enabling a destination mapping rule by using the command line
task.shortdesc: System administrators can enable a destination mapping rule by using the update DestinationMappingRule command with the Enabled=True flag.

taskbody.context: You can enable a destination mapping rule by using the command line, or by using the . For more information about using the to enable a destination mapping rule, see .

step.cmd: To enable a destination mapping rule, enter the following command:
step.info:
It is necessary to capitalize each command parameter, and to use the double quotation marks as shown.
update DestinationMappingRule "Name=DMRname" "Enabled=True"Where:
DMRname Specifies the name of the destination mapping rule you want to enable.

taskbody.example: This example demonstrates enabling a destination mapping rule called exampleRule. update DestinationMappingRule "Name=exampleRule" "Enabled=True" The requested configuration change has completed successfully.
